references.referenced_document_title: Framework to address the ‘technical glitches' in Stock Brokers' Electronic Trading Systems
references.context_paragraph: 1. SEBI vide Circular No. SEBI/HO/MIRSD/TPD-1/P/CIR/2022/160 dated November 25, 2022 laid down a comprehensive framework to address the technical glitches in stock brokers' electronic trading systems. Subsequently, Stock Exchanges also issued detailed guidelines in this regard on December 16, 2022.

references.exact_citation_text: detailed guidelines in this regard on December 16, 2022
references.context_paragraph: 1. SEBI vide Circular No. SEBI/HO/MIRSD/TPD-1/P/CIR/2022/160 dated November 25, 2022 laid down a comprehensive framework to address the technical glitches in stock brokers' electronic trading systems. Subsequently, Stock Exchanges also issued detailed guidelines in this regard on December 16, 2022.

references.referenced_document_title: Framework to address the ‘technical glitches' in Stock Brokers' Electronic Trading Systems
references.exact_citation_text: SEBI circular no SEBI/HO/MIRSD/TPD-1/P/CIR/2022/160 dated November 25, 2022
references.context_paragraph: 14. This circular shall supersede earlier SEBI circular no SEBI/HO/MIRSD/TPD-1/P/CIR/2022/160 dated November 25, 2022.

references.referenced_document_title: Securities and Exchange Board of India Act
references.exact_citation_text: Section 11 (1) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act 1992
references.context_paragraph: 16. This circular is being issued in exercise of powers conferred under Section 11 (1) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act 1992 and Regulation 50 of SEBI (Stock Brokers) Regulations 2026, to protect the interests of investors in securities and to promote the development of, and to regulate the securities market.

16. This circular is being issued in exercise of powers conferred under Section 11 (1) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act 1992 and Regulation 50 of SEBI (Stock Brokers) Regulations 2026, to protect the interests of investors in securities and to promote the development of, and to regulate the securities market.
